intro: Macrolenes dimorpha, commonly known as the two-form macrolene, is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive morphological features. It belongs to the family of plants that exhibit dimorphism, meaning it has two distinct forms within the same species. The plant displays variations in leaf structure and flower morphology depending on environmental conditions. Its botanical significance lies in its ability to adapt to different ecological niches, which makes it an interesting subject for botanical research. The study of Macrolenes dimorpha provides insights into plant evolution and morphological plasticity.
